dialogue.raw_text: Written by Guy Ritchie June 19, 2007 WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07                                  1. 1   INT. DERELICT BUILDING - DAY                                      1 WE MEET: MUMBLES(late 30s) and ONE TWO (late 30s). They are listening to a sales pitch from two REAL ESTATE AGENTS. We SEE all the relevant pictures of their pitch explaining a changing city, LONDON.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two years ago this property cost one million pounds. (we SEE building) Today, it costs five million. The camera WHIP PANS over to another part of the building to see the other ESTATE AGENT giving his pitch. The camera will keep this back and forth for the duration of the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did this happen? (CUT TO relevant pictures as he speaks) Attractive tax opportunities for foreign investment, restrictive building consent and massive hedge fund bonuses,... (beat) London, my good man, is fast becoming the financial and cultural capital of the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And of course the Russians have come to town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Makes it hard to compete with an ex- Soviet oligarch that has six billion dollars in his back pocket. They don't haggle the price, they double the price.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russians come, prices rise, and it doesn't stop. It only goes one way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't teach you how to skin a cat, but I can tell you a lot about the money in bricks and mortar. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision    -   6-20-07                                   1A. 1   CONTINUED:                                                           1 SLICK ESTATE AGENT (CONT'D) Like he said, it's going one way. You need to see a lawyer. (CONTINUED) ROCKNROLLA PINK Revision    -   6-19-07                                2. 1   CONTINUED: (2)                                                   1 One Two and Mumbles look at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to see a Lawyer. 2   INT. LAWYER'S OFFICE                                             2 CUT TO a modern looking LAWYER'S office.   We SEE the LAWYER advising MUMBLES AND ONE TWO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say it's only going one way. 3   EXT. STREET - DAY                                                3 ONE TWO and the LAWYER are here looking at the building, it is a bit dilapidated and bleak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It looks like a great deal. 4   INT. LAWYER'S OFFICE                                             4 We cut back into the office where the LAWYER lays out the building plans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are the plans,...it costs ten and it'll be worth twenty with planning. But first you gotta give the councilor a drink. 5   INT. COUNCILOR'S OFFICE                                          5 CUT TO the desk of a COUNCILOR (mid thirties middle management)who is receiving a brown envelope from the LAWYER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (off the envelope) Tell them they'll get the planning,... 6   INT. LAWYER'S OFFICE                                             6 We CUT BACK to our LAWYER now smug.    One Two and Mumbles are standing in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll get the planning. Take care of the councilor and it will move like shit through a goose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision   -   6-20-07                               2A. 6A   INT. SPEELER                                                    6A ONE TWO We need help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lenny Cole?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dog number one,...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But he moves fast and he loves bricks and mortar. 7    INT. LENNY COLE'S OFFICE                                        7 MEET LENNY COLE(50s, dark, a little tubby), Mumbles and One Two are here. Lenny's office is kitsch, he fancies himself as a man of class.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do move fast and I love bricks and mortar, properties are always the safe bet, but you better know what you're doing 'cos this ain't soft money. You trip up,... (beat) And it's not me that's gonna get hurt. You got security?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got property.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't let me down boys. (beat) Come on then, give us your hand. They shake hands and sign the papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision   -   6-19-07                                     3. 8    INT. COUNCILOR'S OFFICE                                              8 The Councilor is the phone to the Lawyer.      He speaks in hushed tones clandestine like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) Can't talk now, but there has been a problem. I can't get you the planning. 9    INT. LAWYER'S OFFICE                                                 9 The Lawyer is on the phone with Mumbles and One Two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) I'm sorry boys, can't get the planning. 9A   INT. SPEELER                                                         9A One two is on the phone.      He looks over to Mumbles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't get the planing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't get the planing? 10   EXT. DERELICT BUILDING                                               10 Lenny is looking out to One Two and Mumbles who are standing outside his car looking very white. Lenny screams from the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean you can't get the fuckin planning? (pointing) There is seven million of my cash in there, without planning it's worth five,...you owe me. I take the building, you lose your share, but I am still outta pocket two large ones. Find it. The window goes up and the car pulls off.      Lenny picks up his phone, he dials huffing and puffing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision   -   6-6-07                                  4. 11   INT. LENNY'S CAR -- CONTINUOUS                                    11 LENNY COLE Is that you Councilor? (Lenny smiles) I hear you got that car you was after,....now, sort the planning out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorted Lenny. He puts the phone down and looks over smiling.     MEET ARCHY (Lenny's right hand man, 50s).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with you Arch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a bit strong isn't it Len? They come from the same place as you, you'll clean 'em out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Same place as me? Do I look like an immigrant Archy? (beat) No one gave me a leg up, did they? They need a bit of fear, 'cos otherwise they're gonna come up against me,...need a little lesson don't they? 12   INT. SPEELER                                                      12 One Two and Mumbles are here, it's quiet until,..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gotta sell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And be left with what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just gotta start again,.... FADE OUT. 13   INT. CORRIDOR OF SPORTS ARENA                                     13 Start CREDITS over sports arena entrance. Lenny is being walked down a corridor, the      walls are lined with photographs of old soccer stars. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision   -   6-20-07                             4A. 13   CONTINUED:                                                     13 On each side of him are two ESCORTS(ex-military types, heavy looking). As they pass each door, we realize where ever he is going, it has to be important. The ESCORTS talk in to their microphones and to the different GUARDS on each door way. (CONTINUED) ROCKNROLLA WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07                                5. 13   CONTINUED: (2)                                                   13 Every now and then we see the SPORTS ARENA in the back ground. At last we reach the main door to the head office. 14   INT. HEAD OFFICE                                                 14 As the door is opened we see a small crowd of MEN in suits gathered around a kind-looking MAN with bright blue eyes. He nods a couple of times. We CUT TO the front of Lenny who is clearly impressed, Mr. Blue eyes pays him no attention. The small crowd of business MEN shake hands and head to the door at which Lenny is waiting patiently. 15   INT. SPORTS ARENA -- DAY                                         15 CLOSE UP on the back of URI (Russian Jew, 40s, slick, and well groomed, he is our Mr. Blue Eyes) overlooking his sports arena. We stay on the back of Uri's head while he is talking to Lenny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glad you could join us here Lenny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's nice to see you Uri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. (there is a pause) I can see we are very much alike you and I Lenny. We like to get things done. (beat) What's it going to cost me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First, let me make clear how much we can help you benefit from this deal. With out me, it will take you five to ten years to get the permission to erect your arena. (beat) Second, with Government policy as it so stands we both know it's unlikely that you'd ever get that consent. (beat) Thirdly, in legal fees, transactions and building consent, you'd be paying 6 to 12 million without any real guarantee of that result. We CUT TO Uri unfazed, he just wants the figure. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision    -   6-20-07                           5A. 15   CONTINUED:                                                   15 URI So Lenny,..... how much? (CONTINUED) ROCKNROLLA PINK Revision    -   6-19-07                               6. 15   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven million Euros. Still unfazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I expect a guarantee that I have consent within six months and no red tape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right Uri, you can consider that done. Pause while tension stews, then,...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drink!     Follow me. 16   INT. SPORTS ARENA - PRIVATE BAR                                 16 Uri walks to the bar. Lenny follows trying to contain his excitement, he's out of his league, a "welcome to the billionaires club" look has struck him pink. Lenny passes a PICTURE that's sat on an EASEL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that's a nice picture Uri, hasn't it got, errrh depth? Uri is at the bar now. He has placed one large tumbler down and is pouring a very very large measure out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That picture has brought me nothing but luck Lenny,..it's my lucky picture. (he has a good idea) You like? Take it for a while, maybe it will give you luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh I couldn't Uri,... Still absorbed with the painting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now we're partners, I insist. I will get it sent around to your house and you can give it back to me when our deal is finalized. Lenny looks at the bar. Uri motions, there is a SMALL KEG of WHISKEY on the bar and only one large glass. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision    -   6-20-07                                 6A. 16   CONTINUED:                                                         16 LENNY COLE I thought you lot drunk Vodka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whiskey is the new Vodka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You not joining me Uri? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision   -   6-6-07                                    7. 16   CONTINUED: (2)                                                      16 URI I don't drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh,...cheers then,...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To success. Lenny awkwardly starts to glug as Uri looks on. 17   INT. LENNY'S CAR - DAY                                              17 Lenny enters the back seat of his car, Archy is waiting for him in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all right there Len?      You look a little pink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Flustered) Turbo, get us a perrier and a wet wipe live-o. Lenny's panting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tried to poison me the dirty Cossack... TURBO (Lenny's driver) is fumbling around in the front seat trying to get ice into a glass from the cooler that sits beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop messing about and give us the bottle Turbo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, how's the billionaires club? Lenny grabs the drink, desperately takes a big glug of water and wipes his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That Communism didn't seem to slow 'em down did it? We've hit the big time here Archy boy! (beat) What's wrong? Where's the old Archy smile? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision    -   6-20-07                              7A. 17   CONTINUED:                                                      17 ARCHY You wanna watch out there. Times are changing, they don't have too much respect for the old school. (CONTINUED) ROCKNROLLA WHITE Revision   -   6-19-07                                8. 17   CONTINUED: (2)                                                   17 LENNY COLE Shut up Archy,... (under his breath) No school like the old school,...I still run this town see? That's why he came to me right? Got that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, got that. 18   INT. SPORTS ARENA - PRIVATE BAR                                  18 Uri looks at VICTOR (Uri's right hand man).   They're looking down at Lenny's disappearing car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you should have leant him your lucky picture?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It makes the peasant feel royal,... don't spoil it, we need him at the moment. I want that consent. (beat) Call the accountant and get her to clear the money. 19   INT. ACCOUNTANT TAX OFFICES                                      19 A man and woman sit on one side of a desk, MEET STELLA AND BERTIE. Bertie is 45 and handsome in a dark posh sort of way. Stella is 32, film star. Sitting opposite them are two TAX MEN(civil servant types, grey, middle aged, a little tubby and bald). There's a stand off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, can we shut the door? There's a pause while the TAX MAN looks at his colleague.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut the door. His colleague gets up and shuts the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's put our cards on the table. We both know you aren't going to get the full forty out of my clients.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the tax office and in the end we get what we want. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision    -   6-19-07                                  9. 19   CONTINUED:                                                         19 STELLA Save that speech for the tourists Charlie and let's strike a deal - take the twenty now and let it go. Otherwise, they'll move the company off shore tomorrow and you'll spend the next twenty years chasing an imaginary forty million around every republic that grows bananas. Bertie lifts out papers from his brief case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see why you married her now Bertie. The two TAX MEN look at each other, they're thinking the same thought. 20   INT. CHAUFFEUR DRIVEN MERCEDES - EVENING                           20 BERTIE I told you we'd make a great team,.. You know why you get those deals? She looks relatively bored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because those fat, sad, old men like it when you swear at them. They shake like cocktails and sweat like semtex when you raise that posh little voice. You my love are a rare commodity. (beat) Now come on, give your Bertie a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't feel like smiling. I am a thirty two year old accountant married to a homosexual lawyer. (beat) I'm a beard without kids Bertie! I'm in a marriage of convenience that can be quite inconvenient at times. The phone rings, Bertie picks it up and answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, she's right here. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision    -   6-20-07                       9A. 20   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Omovich. (mincey) Are you sure he isn't gay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't do a five, they've got nothing on you Handsome Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about Fred? They got an informer, a grass, and a rat with a roach-smoking-a canary,..they've got more information than the fuckin Internet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Language,...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, like I said, nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave him alone Fred, you're stressing him out. Dolly get him a cuppa tea. (beat) Come on deal the cards Fred. We see in the background someone coming in. MEET COOKIE(late 30s, slicked back, black hair), his look is a bit of a parody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right chaps?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right Cookie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want to be dealt in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't stay for long, but throw us in for a quick spin. One Two, who has been on the phone finishes his call.    He looks over to Mumbles. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision    -   6-20-07                      10A. 21   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mumbles, can I have a word?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know the lady, the posh one who likes abitta the rough life?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The accountant, what about her? You haven't heard from her in a while, too dangerous that one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Says she's got some work, you know,... proper work. (he makes gun impression) I would normally turn her down, but considering,...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's have a meet. 23   INT. ART GALLERY - NEXT DAY                                    23 Stella's here admiring an abstract picture of nothingness. One Two sits next to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got one like that at home with a little boy fishing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what they call humor where you come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, don't they call that art where you come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're quite the entertainer aren't you Mr. One Two? And you are late, please don't be late, I have a very busy schedule. 24   INT. ART GALLERY - CORRIDOR                                    24 They walk down the corridor. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision    -    6-20-07                               11A. 24   CONTINUED:                                                         24 STELLA I have some work and thought you'd be interested, its your kind of work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision   -   6-6-07                               12. 24   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are two accountants taking out seven million Euros from a bank I know and it won't be protected. (beat) Twenty percent for me, as normal. The details are in here. She passes an envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes,..I don't want this coming back to me so, if you could give them a black eye,..that might help. She see's a slight pause and look of concern from One Two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A black eye, nothing more. She passes him an envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ok, very good Mrs. Dexter, a black eye it is then. He looks down at her shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (she smiles) Why thank you, you'll be able to afford your own pair in a couple of days. Good bye. He watches her walk off, he likes her, she likes him. 25   INT. BACK OFFICE OF MUSIC VENUE                                 25 Two guys are here counting money. MEET ROMAN and MICKEY, two black Americans. (Mid 30s dressed very classy, with a bit of an urban twist) They are in the managing game, exploiting the talents of the English. The sound of distant bass thudding through the walls can be heard while Mickey is on the phone trying to do some kind of business. A real ROCKER with long hair and good looks comes walking in distressed. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision       -   6-6-07                              13. 25   CONTINUED:                                                         25 ROCKER I need the dry ice Mickey, I need the dry ice. My show just doesn't work without it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you told me yesterday you needed dry ice, I would have gotten you the driest ice the world could offer, but you didn't ask for no dry ice. You asked for two cases of Johnny Walker black label and four ladies of the pole and I got them for you didn't I? There's a pause from the Rocker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you did I do confess, but Mickey, you're the manager and I am the rocker. You've got on the managers hat, now pluck something out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My hat is deep and full of magic. I got rabbits, handkerchiefs, and ladies of the pole drinking Black Label. I got smoke machines, bubble machines, I even got love marines and still the hat goes deeper, but....there ain't no mother fuckin dry ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ok, ok, come home, you've made your point. (he turns on his way out) But tomorrow, I need dry ice. ROMAN looks up from his paper, having not got involved in the slightest. Roman taps the paper he has been reading.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you read this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? He reads out the headlines. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision   -   6-6-07                                   14. 25   CONTINUED: (2)                                                      25 ROMAN Johnny Story singer extraordinaire, fell off a boat, they say. Missing, assumed dead, they say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What,..our Johnny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many rock stars by the name of Johnny Story do you think there are in this universe Mickey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The only thing he's fallen off is his junkies spoon, he's no deader than the suit you're wearing now. He'll be gearing himself up somewhere happy as clam in a fisherman's net. Rockers like that never die, they just wither and give me pain. 26   EXT. TENNIS CLUB - DAY                                              26 On the tennis court we see the COUNCILOR(our man from the beginning), who is playing tennis with TERRY THE INSTRUCTOR. The Councilor is taking it seriously apart from the distraction of JACKIE on the next door court. ARCHY is here watching over the game and reading the paper, we see him read an article and look a little moved. Lenny comes up behind him and starts to read over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnny Story singer extraordinare, fell off a boat, missing, assumed dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what to say Lenny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet he took a lot of people with him in his hot little crack pipe. (beat) We will never mention this again, all right Arch? Archy looks a little shocked.     Lenny carries on like nothing has happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, tell the Councilor to stop fuckin about with sticks and balls and send him inside. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision   -   6-20-07                            14A. 26   CONTINUED:                                                    26 Lenny walks into the bar and Archy moves on to the court. (CONTINUED) ROCKNROLLA WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07                               15. 26   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good councilor, you must of had lessons as a boy. (beat) Fancy a cool down and a chat with Lenny? The Councilor slyly looks over to Jackie, she looks back. The Councilor is thinking explicit thoughts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know Jackie? Nervous, the Councilor knows these thugs aren't shy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, no, Archy, don't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, she's a friend,..and a member. (raises his voice) Jackie,..fancy a run'a'round with the Councilor? Pause.   She looks sullen, stroppy and rude all at the same time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only if he's wicked. She turns away to hit a ball, the Councilor's heart skips a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does she mean by that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think she likes you boy-o. 27   INT. TENNIS CLUB BAR                                            27 Lenny is at the bar on his own looking at the papers and picking at the nuts. In walks the Councilor with Archy, the Councilor sits next to Lenny at the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say that times are changing Councilor, that this country isn't what it used to be, it's the new New York, they say. You being a political man must know all about that. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision   -   6-20-07                          15A. 27   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision   -   6-6-07                                  16. 27   CONTINUED: (2)                                                     27 COUNCILOR Errh, I think they are probably right, times have changed, but that shouldn't affect you Lenny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say it's all gone "international" now, out with the old guard in with the new, but I think they're wrong. (beat) Anyway, where are my manners? Look at you sweaty as a native and pink as a pelican,...and I haven't even offered you a wet one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lemonade and orange please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh that's nice,..refreshing, that'll put you back on top boy. Lenny pulls out the plans and a leather pack of cigars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here you go, plans and papers. (beat) Would you like a cigar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't mind if I do,...that's a nice lighter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight grand they wanted for it cheeky toads and I paid, you know why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me Lenny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cos it's all about the details. Looking at the plans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (awkwardly) Is our little deal in there too Lenny? Lenny milks the silence while he lights his cigar, the Councilor feels like a prick waiting, it goes on and on. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision    -   6-20-07                           16A. 27   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh I wouldn't forget that, the most important things first. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revision    -   6-19-07                                  17. 27   CONTINUED: (4)                                                      27 He puts the Dunhill lighter down on the plans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll leave you with them. (beat) I gotta run, can't stay here chewing the fat all day, a mans got to make a living. Call me in the 'morrow. He walks toward the door as Jackie is walking in, Lenny looks slyly at her as they pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look after him Jackie. In the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Lenny, you forgot your lighter. Lenny looks back to the Councilor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't be mine, it's got your name on it. CUT TO the bottom of the lighter, "THE COUNCILOR." Lenny carries on walking and smiling. 28   EXT. PARK - MORNING                                                 28 It's the next morning, we SEE One Two running. Mumbles and Handsome Bob pull up along side of him in their car. There is a moment of pause while they admire One Two running along side of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you get bored of that? I mean, your not really going anywhere. If you wanna run, why don't you run to the shops or do something useful?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could do with some of this yourself Mumbles, you're letting yourself go. (beat) Anyway, I'm busy, have you come to talk about anything important?
direction.name: direction
